Damn! Wouldn't you know it? The line was dead.

She ran back outside, holding her pistol. The fog seemed somehow more dense now.

Well, she thought. I'm not going to let strange behavior and dead phone lines creep me out. Got to check that fog out.

She slowly made her way to where the wall of fog began. Gathering her courage, she took a deep breath and stepped into it.

It was just fog, and nothing happened... then.

Exhaling, she began to walk through it. The sound of leaves was crunching under her feet as she walked. Vaguely she wondered what lay ahead for her. Why was the fog there in the first place, it seemed unnatural for fog to begin so suddenly. The strange behavior of Beck began to nag at the back of her mind as well.

She began to walk further into the fog, clutching the gun with a vise-like grip.

"Who's out there?" She called. "I've got a gun!"

A shadowy figure loomed before her and she fell backwards, firing a shot off. The figure disappeared.

Krystal turned and began to run the way she thought was back to the cabin. But she must have been disoriented because the fog only seemed to get thicker.

The crunch of leaves behind her set her running faster.

She stumbled over a rock and fell head first into the dirt.

The footsteps, very rapid, drew to a stop right next to her.

Looking up, she had no time to register the fact that the large black ovals were eyes before the sharp pain in her neck put her into unconsciousness.



Darkness engulfed Krystal when she awoke. She was lying on her back. Her hand slid to the surface she was on and sank into it. It was a thick gelatin of some kind that adhered to her skin. She could feel thick slime resisting the pull of her hand when she tried to draw it out.

She put her hand above her face and felt the same substance.

She was encapsuled in some kind of gel. Claustrophobia nearly took all of her sanity at that moment.

Desperately she drove both of her hands into the gel surface above her. The surface gave, but did not break. Pushing with all of her strength, it finally broke after she had nearly strained her arm muscles.

She could see light now, and she ripped and tore at the surface until it became wide enough for her to stick her head through.

She was in a vast chamber. The boundaries seemed limitless. It was a cylindrical chamber, and she was coming out of a cell in the wall.

There were thousands of cells around her in every direction. She thought that they all held at least one human, live or dead she did not know.

She climbed out of the chamber, but just then, gravity reversed, and she fell towards the center of the cylinder. Hundreds of feet she flew, until she passed the center, and then gravity reversed again. Her direction changed once more. This happened about twenty times before the forces equalized and she was floating in the middle of the cylinder.

Another directional force, one she had not noticed, was pulling her in one direction through the cylinder. The darkness at the end of the cylinder gradually illuminated until she could see down into the base of the cylinder.

A feeling of desperation overcame her when she saw bipedal creatures that were not human walking about below her.

Considering there was no way for Krystal to direct herself - because she was in no way in control of the force that pulled her downward - she prepared herself to land anywhere she could and, with no small amount of courage, pulled the gun out from behind her back, and pulled back the hammer.

The click-click noise that the gun made reverberated throughout the chamber and down into the area below. All but one creature kept going about their business. It looked up at her, and that was when her heart stopped.

It was the most haunting thing she had ever seen. It was everything she had ever seen on T.V., except its nightnmarish appearance was even more evil. It stood about seven feet tall and had a bald head, no visible ears, a small nose, gray, leathery skin, a small slit for a mouth, and deep, large sable-black eyes that looked up at her with an expression of pure malice and hate. The shock it gave her to see such a creature made fear darker than any labyrinth in her soul wrack her body. Her hands started shaking and her breath started to become labored. She started to cry.

Get a grip! she told herself. Survival instincts and adrenaline were what took over from there.

When she landed, she luckily landed in a secluded spot somewhat hidden from most of the creatures, behind a pillar-like structure. But the one being that had spotted her soon confronted her. Slowly she saw it reveal its head from behind the pillar. So close it was then that Krystal nearly collapsed by the sight of it. Her heart rapped at her chest, but her adrenaline forced her to quickly lift the gun, and pull the trigger.

"W-What's going on?" Krystal asked, frightened by the day's events.

"I will tell you later. Right now, we have to get to town. They are coming."The man replied, Krystal could notice a strange tattoo on the side of his face.

"Who's coming?"Krystal asked, shivering in fear.

"...The shapeshifters."The man spoke quickly, fear could be heard in his otherwise gruff voice.
123112.title: The Coming

choices: Join Dr.C and stop the aliens
Decline, the offer
1231121.content:
They arrived in town just as it turned to night. The man pulled up in front of Emmet's Pub, and ordered Krystal to follow him inside. She did as she was told. He pushed open the front door, and the stale odor of booze and cigarettes hit her hard. Men were lined up along the bar, and a bunch crowded around tables. It was a packed night. A man in a black suit in a corner table saw them, and waved them over. Krystal and the other man went over, and sat down.

"Excellent job Agent 3A, when you get home, I'll make sure to wire over the money." The man spoke quietly, yet boldly.

"I'll wait ouside." Agent 3A said as he stood up, and walked out the front door.

"Hello Krystal, my name's Dr.C, you don't need to know my real name, it's not important. I'm guessing you already saw them, the shapeshifters."Dr.C asked her.

"If you're talking about the aliens, then yes I have." Krystle replied, frightened.

"The shapeshifters have been here for thousands of years, Krystal. But now, they're ready to take our world. They're impersonating humans, and we must stop them. You're the one who will."Dr. C explained.

"Me?" Krystal asked.

"Yes. I knew your father Krystal, he was an agent for me. Before you were born, he led an attack on a Shapeshifter vessel. He was caught, and they injected strange chemicals into him, I'm not sure what. When you were born, these chemicals were born into you...giving you the ability to see things, normal people can't."Dr. C explained some more.

"See what things?"Krystal asked.

"Krystal, I want you to concentrate really hard. I want you to use those chemicals in your body, tell your brain to send the chemical into your eyes."Dr. C replied.

"I can't tell chemicals to go into my eyes!"Krystal angrily shouted back.

"Yes you can Krystal, remember, you're not a normal human being. You have alien chemicals in you, they give you alien properties. Please, try it."Dr. C spoke once more.

Krystal nodded slowly. She closed her eyes, and thought very hard. She told her brain she wanted the chemicals to go into her eyes. When she opened them again, the entire world was in a green tint.

"Oh my god. Everything's green..."Krystal muttered in shock.

"Yes Krystal. You have it in you. You are seeing what aliens see. Take a look at the men in the bar, in the green." Dr. C told her.

Krystal turned and looked. Some of the men in the bar, now appeared as aliens in the green. They were already assimilating...

"Krystal, I need your help. The aliens are starting their attack, and they're starting it in this town. I need you to come with me, I need you to find all the aliens for us. You're the only ones that can tell us who's real, and who's not. Will you do it?"

12312.content:
Slowly, slowly she made her descent. She started to panic. What could she do?

The creatures below her were grotesque; gnarled and hideous. They had raven hair all over their heads and faces, but piercing sapphire eyes could still be seen, even through their matted tresses. They were hunched over, and moved in a scuttling manner.

Suddenly, an identical pair looked up, staring straight at her with those sharp cerulean eyes. She clapped her hands to her ears - the noise! It was unbearable.

She flopped to the ground, and huddled up. She didn't want to look at them..

Krystal had to get out of the strange place. Now. Who knows what the weird aliens would do to her.

Would they disect Krystal? Mutate her? And even worse-- EAT her?!

There was no way Krystal would let herself be killed.

She quickly scanned her surroundings, trying to find some sort of exit, and was surprised to see that she was in what seemed like a hospital room-- an alien's hospital room.

12422.content:
Krystal thought for a moment and took in her surroundings.

The floor on which she lay was metal and cold. She found the cold comforting, about the only thing that was.

The aliens looked like a cross between E.T. and the aliens from Close Encounter. Behind the aliens she saw what appeared to sliding doors. The rest of the room had the charm of a metal culvert.

She still felt her pistol, tucked under her body as she lay on the floor.

"What happened to Biff? He was talking to you, then he died. Are you responsible?"

"Biff? You mean the dude who looked like Beck? I don't know. Maybe it was lead poisoning. That's fairly common on my planet."

The aliens looked at each other, confused. Krystal slowly moved into a sitting position, careful to keep the gun concealed.

"What is this lead poisoning of which you speak?"

"This," she said was she brought out the gun and killed the aliens.

Her ears ringing from the gunshots in the small metal room, she examine the aliens. Unlike in the movies, the aliens' blood was not acid, it looked strangely like milk.

She quickly got to her feet and--avoiding the bodies--ran to the door. After trying several buttons next to the door, she got the panels to slide apart.

The door opened on a hallway that went to the right and left of the room.

The hallway curved and twisted for what
seemed like miles. Krystal could feel her
heart pounding in her chest. After walking for a
while, she could hear the faint beat of "New
Pollution", by Beck! Always having been a fan
of the progressive artist, she carefully crept
forward into the next room.

She was amazed to find hundreds upon
hundreds of people that looked, amazingly,
like Beck! They were all grooving to the toons.
Krystal looked around at them all, at the disco
ball on the ceiling, and finally at the 1957 Ford
Comet nustled in a corner.

Her hand around her gun for comfort, she
slowly tip toed her way to the door and got in. It
was just like her first car, the one she wrecked
in High School when she ran over the kid in
the wheelchair, except for two buttons.

"Hey, get her!" one of the Becks yelled. Krystal
turned to see the Becks approaching her,
each dancing as they moved. She turned her
attention back to the buttons. Each of the said
something.

Krystal didn't know what she'd pressed, but that car suddenly let out a stinking belch of exhaust... What did this thing burn anyway? Well, no time to think about that, there's too many creatures in here boogying to the beat of a pretty odd drum.

"Where's the door? How in the hell am I going to get out of here?" Krystal thought as she slammed her foot down on what she assumed what going to be an accelerator... oops. All that did was make the exhaust, or what she thought was exhaust, worse. "Let's try another one", and with that the car started forward, ramming through the wall of the little disco and falling through the air.

There are tons of buttons and levers Krystal could try, experimenting to save her life, or she can grab one of the seat covers and turn it into a little parachute like they do it in the cartoons...

Krystal started to press and poke at the buttons, not getting anywhere. Soon, there was only one button left. It was a big red one that read 'do not press'. In her desperation, she closed her eyes and pressed the button. The car began to sputter and shake. Everything seemed to fall away from her as she was sucked out of the ship. When she opened her eyes again, she was still in the car, only on what looked like Earth.
Krystal stepped out of the car without making a sound. She looked around curiously. She was surrounded by trees and a very dense fog.

info.brief_description: A northern town has a community of farmers, growing a very strange crop.
info.description: Krystal Bennet has finally worked long enough at her job to request a leave of absense to work on a mystery novel that has been burning inside her for years, but when the mystery surrounding her new community takes up all her time, the fate of her novel may take a back burner to saving the world.
